origin: Latin: ducere (to lead), ductus (past participle stem)
explanation: The root **duct** comes from the Latin verb *ducere*, meaning **"to lead"** or **"to draw"**. This core meaning is evident in English words where it refers to guiding, directing, or bringing something along a path, often implying movement or formation.
level_note: This root is found in words across B1, B2, and C1 CEFR levels, often combining with common prefixes.

words.logic: Con- (cùng nhau/với) + duct (dẫn dắt) = dẫn dắt cùng nhau, thực hiện một nhiệm vụ, hoặc cách thức ai đó cư xử/dẫn dắt bản thân.
words.meaning_vi: thực hiện, tiến hành; cư xử; dẫn (nhiệt, điện)
words.meaning_en: to organize and carry out; to behave in a particular way; to transmit (heat, electricity)
words.example: The committee decided to conduct a full investigation into the matter.

collocations.example: Scientists will conduct an experiment to test the new hypothesis.
We aim to conduct business ethically and responsibly.
Students are expected to conduct themselves respectfully on campus.

forms.example: His conduct during the meeting was exemplary.
The orchestra conductor raised his baton.
Heat conduction is faster in metals than in wood.

words.logic: Pro- (về phía trước) + duce (dẫn dắt) = dẫn dắt ra phía trước, tạo ra cái gì đó mới, hoặc làm cho nó hiện ra.
words.meaning_vi: sản xuất, tạo ra; trưng ra, trình ra
words.meaning_en: to make or create something; to bring something into existence; to show or present something
words.example: This factory can produce over a thousand units per day.

collocations.example: The lawyer was asked to produce evidence to support his claims.
Hard work and dedication always produce positive results.
You need to produce a valid ID to enter the building.

forms.example: Their latest product is a revolutionary smartphone.
The film producer oversaw the entire movie-making process.
The new car model went into full production last month.

words.logic: Intro- (vào trong) + duce (dẫn dắt) = dẫn dắt vào trong, tức là giới thiệu một người hoặc một ý tưởng mới, hoặc đưa vào sử dụng.
words.meaning_vi: giới thiệu; đưa vào; bắt đầu (sử dụng)
words.meaning_en: to present someone or something for the first time; to bring into use or existence
words.example: Let me introduce you to my colleague, Sarah.

collocations.example: The speaker will introduce a new topic for discussion at the conference.
The company plans to introduce a new system for managing customer data.
It's good manners to introduce yourself to new neighbors.

forms.example: The introduction of the book provides a good overview.
He gave an introductory speech before the main presentation.
The introducer briefly highlighted the speaker's achievements.

words.logic: De- (xuống/đi khỏi) + duct (dẫn dắt) = dẫn dắt đi xuống hoặc đi khỏi, tức là trừ đi, bớt đi một phần từ tổng số.
words.meaning_en: to take away an amount or part from a total
words.example: The company will deduct a certain amount from your salary for taxes.

collocations.example: You can often deduct business expenses from your taxable income.
The teacher might deduct points for late homework submissions.
Please deduct the cost of shipping from the total payment.

forms.example: Tax deductions can significantly lower your tax bill.
My insurance policy has a $1000 deductible.

words.logic: Ab- (khỏi/xa khỏi) + duct (dẫn dắt) = dẫn dắt đi xa khỏi một cách trái phép, thường là dùng vũ lực hoặc lừa gạt.
words.meaning_en: to take someone away illegally by force; to kidnap
words.example: Police are investigating reports that a child was abducted from the playground.

collocations.example: The criminals attempted to abduct a victim for ransom.
The suspect was accused of trying to abduct the person by force.
The family immediately reported the abduction to the authorities.

forms.example: The abduction case made headlines across the country.
The abductor was identified through security camera footage.
The abducted children were found safe after a week-long search.

memory_logic.meaning: dẫn dắt, kéo (to lead, to draw)
